text: Adinandra griffithii is a species of plant in the Pentaphylacaceae family. ==Description== The tree species is endemic to Meghalaya state in northeast India. Adinandra griffithii is a small tree confined to Cherrapunji and Shongpung forests. It is an IUCN Red List Endangered species, threatened by habitat loss. At Cherrapunji in the East Khasi Hills district a cement factory has caused the loss of habitat. ==References== griffithii Category:Flora of Meghalaya Category:East Khasi Hills district Category:Endangered flora of Asia Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Adinandra griffithii
